reviews.review_msg: Grace, why did you give us two midterms, a final 8 page paper, a final exam and a group project/debate in the same class? And why are you so boring? And you made your obscure textbook (aka unpirateable) (that you wrote) required reading? We have to pay you too? Why are all the test questions so backward and inappropriate for testing?

Dont be fooled by these reviews, Grace is a really good, caring & understanding Prof. Although worthy quite a lot, The class paper was really easy to do as it didnt have a lot of constraints and had a clear outline. The exams are VERY fair so long as you come to class and glance at teh readings. You'll do well! Very chill class, would recommend.

Grace is caring and approachable. Readings are not necessary and tests were heavily based on the lectures. Heavily weighted assignments due within a short time-frame. The lecture material itself is interesting and the course is organized but the expectations are not quite clear despite having a rubric.

Not very happy with this professor. She does not seem to be very involved with the course. The class is based around debates and we are expected to learn off of her recorded lectures. The term paper was very confusing and messy, I spent a lot of time wondering if I had even done it right. I have read that her TA's for the course mark very hard too
Her lectures are interesting and easy to follow with up-to-date information on all of the topics. Takes interest in her students and takes time to respond to emails and questions in class.

Grace is very nice and knowledgeable, however, class is TERRIBLY ORGANIZED. Papers harshly marked by TA and these count for 40%.. Lectures filled with anecdotes unrelated to class, and UNRELATED to exams in terms of level difficulty. I regret taking the course. Curving system is messed up too. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

-lectures disorganized and rushed over slides -exams did not match class material and paper marked hard with inconsistencies with rubric -BEWARE OF TEXTBOOK- Grace's txt is required but only 5 chapters for 13wk semester assigned- I had success without use -lots of readings on canvas from other sources -SUPER short exams- MINIMAL ROOM FOR ERROR -

Do not recommend this class - so unorganized with impossible exams that are difficult to study for. The TA laura is an actual goddess (wow) and the star is for her because she took the time to help me understand the material and learn how to score better on the exams. Avoid this class but if you must take it use the TA for help
Grace is a lovely lady, but her class and lectures are super unorganized. It seemed like the class was not prepared properly in advance as the lectures and tests didn't match up well.

Selected studies - developmental disabilities. Class and lectures were not organized well. Too much time spent on anecdotal stories from students. No real prep for mid term or cumulative final. Says to focus on bigger picture but tests on specifics.
Horribly organized,  doesn't test on what she teaches, doesn't clarify and expects a wealth of knowledge on a specific subject that she does not teach.

Grace clearly wants her students to succeed!! She is helpful with providing extra guidance and information about assignments. She encourages discussion about controversial issues and is open to views opposing her own which helps facilitate well rounded learning about somewhat merky issues in psychology.

HORRIBLE professor! The class material is quite interesting, but she does a horrendous job teaching it! Avoid her at all costs!  Horrid exams - over 200 multiple choice and over ten short answer questions in three hours (taken from test bank no less) test speed rather than knowledge! HATED this class.

An okay prof that doesn't really stand out. REALLY sticks to the textbook and basically repeats what the book says. Doesn't add anything to the lectures that you can't get from the book. Uses a test-bank for the exams. BEWARE FINAL EXAM IS HARD! 190 MC and 15 SA. Everyone was upset... I won't take her again.

Worst teacher ever. Her exams were RICKdiculously long and hard and she tested us specific details that require an incredible amount of studying. Very unfair midterms and finals. Avoid at all costs and i still remember at least half of the people doing their exams in the Shrum science building were still there after the alloted 3 hours.

Went to 3 lectures the entire semester and came out with an A+.  If you take this course, make better use of your time by reading the text during lecture time instead of actually going. Her lectures repeat the text book completely..sometimes word for word.

This was a TERRIBLE class. You dont even need to go to class, all her notes are online and they are direct summaries from the textbook!  No tutorials suked, and the TA's were useless.  Her exams were super unfair, and her ability to instruct the material was the worst I have ever seen.  RUN AWAY from this teacher, she is AWFUL!!!
I'm probably going to have to retake this, a first for me. Dissapointing.

worst professor ever boring monotonous lectures with ridiculously long final. tiny little details were tested & they were completely irrelevant info that had one sentence in the text. it's easy to pull questions out from the text but it's hard for students to memorize every single little detail. final's length did not allow time to think abt answer
RUN!!!!!! RUN FOR YOUR LIFE! Worst class/grading/tests ever. Also, the TA was amazingly terrible. If you can take this elsewhere, do. If you can't, I'm very sorry.

BOOOOOOOORING. Also she seems nice, but a lazy teacher. All multiple choice questions have answers that could all be argued as the correct choice. Lectures are monotonous and oh so boring. Avoid if possible. Final was a massive number of multiple choice questions and short answers - too many for the time period allowed

Seems nice, but teaching apears lazy. Nearly all test questions are from the text, and VERY ambigious. 
 Example of a question: 
 -Educated women tend to see the role of females as:
 a-similar to males.
 b-having greater independence and achievement striving.
 c-less emotional.
 d-more competent.
 You could argue almost any answer. 
 
 Also- crappy
No Comments
ahhh! helP!. am i in hell?
No Comments

Do not take a class with her if you can help it. She blantantly favors certain students (especially her own). If you're not one of the chosen few she likes, forget doing well in her class. Not even a mind reader could figure out her ever changing and inconsistent expectations.
No Comments
No Comments
